items.title: An All AI Portfolio: AI Already Has ROI
Is IBM cool again?
items.description: Also: Trump says Xi is "hard to make a deal with," Wells Fargo is out of the doghouse, and Ray Dalio rings in AI era.

items.title: New MLPerf Training v5.0 Benchmark Results Reflect Rapid Growth and Evolution of the Field of AI
items.author: Mlcommons
items.description: MLCommons announced new results for the MLPerf Training v5.0 benchmark suite, highlighting rapid growth and evolution in the field of AI. The benchmark suite includes a new large language model pretraining benchmark based on the Llama 3.1 405B generative AI system, and the results show notable performance improvements for newer benchmarks.

insights.sentiment_reasoning: AMD is mentioned as one of the companies that submitted results to the MLPerf Training v5.0 benchmark, indicating their involvement and participation in the industry-leading AI benchmark.
IBM is mentioned as a first-time MLPerf Training submitter, which suggests their increased involvement and interest in the AI benchmark.

NVIDIA is mentioned as one of the companies that submitted results, including new processor families like the Blackwell GPU, indicating their continued leadership and innovation in the AI hardware space.
